result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:03 AM Defendant RYAN D DEVEAU in court.  Attorney David W. Field in court for RYAN D DEVEAU.  Prosecuting attorney Scott Zehr in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
21CF109, 22CF12, 22CF68, 22CF69
Defendant informed of charges and penalties. 
Defendant Advised of Constitutional Rights. 
21CF109 Ct 1 and Ct 3, 22CF12 Ct 2 and Ct 3, 22CF68 Ct 1 and Ct 2:
Defendant enters no contest plea.
Factual basis and probable cause found. 
Court accepts pleas as voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently made and finds defendant guilty. 

All other counts and 22CF69 entirely DRI

Court orders:
21CF109 Ct 1 and Ct 3, 22CF12 Ct 2 and Ct 3, 22CF68 Ct 1 and Ct 2:
S/W - 3 years probation
AODA and follow through
any counseling
drugs/para/shot/norx

21CF109 Ct 3 - $518
22CF12 Ct 2- $528

22CF68 Ct 1- $518

Credit to be determined and filed with CoC by 10/21/22

Consecutive to Eau Claire County 21CF109, 22CF215, 21CF594

Defendant incarcerated at ECCJ.
Adjourned.
Review hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:25 AM Prosecuting attorney Sheila M. Yohnk in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant RYAN D DEVEAU appeared by video, in custody in ECCJ.  Attorney David W. Field in court for RYAN D DEVEAU. 
ADA Yohnk preparing new offer. Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Review hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

09:04 AM Defendant RYAN D DEVEAU in court with Attorney David W. Field.  Sheila M. Yohnk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
21CF109, 22CF22, 22CF68, 22CF12 w/ 22TR34 riding along. Working on resolution- restitution. 
Defendant reminded to comply with pretrial monitoring. Bond continued.  Review hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.

BOND COVERS 22CF69 (new) and 22CF68 (amended).
Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial monitoring conditions. 
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia / any syringes unless medically required.
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs / any prescription drugs not prescribed.
No contact with victim 1, their residence, or place of business.
